Topic.Title: Anything important to know before hitting 'publish' button?

Posts.EditableText:
Hi,

I've finished coding and testing my first game, is there anything I need to be aware of before hitting the publish button? I presume I can still go back and fix any other bugs that appear later? What does 'publish' actually do. Sorry for noob question!
Posts.HTML:
Hi,

I've finished coding and testing my first game, is there anything I need to be aware of before hitting the publish button? I presume I can still go back and fix any other bugs that appear later? What does 'publish' actually do. Sorry for noob question!

Posts.EditableText:
When you publish, you have the option to make it public or keep it private so that only those for whom you provide the link can access it.

As for fixing bugs, if you simply edit the exiting game and retain the same ID, it should update the existing game when you upload it again.
Posts.HTML:
When you publish, you have the option to make it public or keep it private so that only those for whom you provide the link can access it.

As for fixing bugs, if you simply edit the exiting game and retain the same ID, it should update the existing game when you upload it again.

Posts.EditableText:
For the details, you might want to read this:
https://github.com/ThePix/quest/wiki/Publishing-Quest-games-(inc.-size-limitations)
